intro: Ceropegia compta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed holotype ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. Ceropegia compta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flowering structure.
